p.s: In the following text, the scene is analyzed and gets structured, in usage of film-stylistic devices.
Starr in this scene sympathizes with Chris, who uses his selfmade beat to easen up Starr's mood and the tension.
The scene can be divided into 3 parts.
In the first part Chris is introduced.
The usage of music plays a big part in his introduction, letting the spectatot know (how Starr views him) of the relationship between Starr and Chris.
Chris gets introduced in wide (shots) shot sizes, that give away how he is viewed in Starr's eyes, centering him in the following shots and blurring the students in his vicinity.
The first part of the scene ends with Chris noticing Starr and the camera moving to Starr as Chris makes eye contact.
With a close up, the situation tenses up and Chris approaches Starr from behind.
The tension easens with Chris showing Starr his self-made beat.
You can interpret this as an apology of Chris and a way to start ofoff the (conversation).
Starr starts to sympathize with Chris, which is shown through her facial expression.
The scene makes it clear when tension breaks, through music.
A conversation follows in which the camera is positioned on eye level in a medium close up.
No music plays as this is a serious conversation, which is not only shown through facial expression, but through the tensed up mood.
You can recognize how Chris leads the situation by staying calm.
The third part of the scene starts at the end of the conversation, as the camera focuses on the phone of Chris, which he then unpluggs.
The third part is mostly music, giving away the resulting mood as they made up.
The color pannel is mostly pale, as this plays in Starr's school.
